text: user: So just to be sure, if i change address again then I should come in and let you know? agent: Yes, and please have your insurance up to date when you do so

user: What kind of proof of insurance do I need? agent:  Your insurance company will issue proof of insurance in two ways: It will give you two original NY State Insurance ID Cards or provide you with access to your digital electronic NY State Insurance ID Card

user: Now, what if I reside in New York City and am exempt from the NYC vehicle use tax? agent: In that case, you should go to a local DMV and get form UT-11, You can also get it from a DMC call center.

agent: If yours was issued before October 30, 2017, then yours is not enhanced. It is known as a Standard ID.

user: Is there an application process for this? agent: Yes. You can apply for a refund of the 2-year registration fee ONLY if the registration was never used and it is not more than 60 days from the date the registration was issued .
user: Do I need to pass one class in order to switch to another? agent: For any and all pre-reqs, please reference the manual you were given when you got your permit.

user: Can i keep my CDL but with restrictions on it? agent: Yes you are eligible for Excepted Intrastate Operation (EA). Make sure that your CDL has the restrictions: K CDL Intrastate Only and A3 Med Cert Exempt
user: What do I need to bring with me? agent: You need your driver's license and additional ID.  The DMV Document Guide shows the whole list of acceptablr ID.
user: What should I do if the plates were stolen? agent: Have a police report made, then replace the plates.
user: When should I not apply for plates? agent: You should not apply for new plates until after you cancel the police alarm for a stolen vehicle.

user: Do cell phone violations affect my reinstatement? agent: Well, yes, if you are found guilty of any cell phone or texting violations.

user: What if I have one drink and then try to drive? I'm still under the limit. agent: All drinking for an interlocked driver is prohibited. Please refer to the monitoring agency for any further questions.

user: What happens in the case of a lienholder being in possession of my title certificate? agent: In a n umber of states, the lienholder keeps the certificate until the lien has been satisfied. The lienholder then sends the title certificate to the owner

user: What data should the proof have? agent: All proof must include the name and address of the registrant and the year, make and vehicle identification number VIN of the vehicle. We will apply your proof to the New York registry to reduce or delete a lapse of insurance coverage reported by your insurance company.
user: How secure are the I-PIRP websites? agent: Very secure. DMV requires sponsors and their delivery agents to provide secure websites that protect your personal information.
user: can I mail in my documents and do it all that way? agent: The transaction can only be processed in person, at a DMV office.

user: Thanks for the information. Are the restrictions on a junior driver license affected by what region I drive in? agent: Yes. Some regions within New York will allow a young driver who holds a junior driver license to drive unsupervised.
user: Is there another resource I could use to get more information?  agent: If you have any additional questions, you can contact the DMV Call Center.
user: and when do inspections expire? agent: A valid inspection tag must be displayed on your vehicle. Inspections expire on the last day of the month marked on the inspection label.

user: and what if my vehicle's inspection tag has expired in the last 60 days agent: You may be fined $ 25 to $ 50.

user: Will the extension sticker be recorded as an inspection on New York State DMV records? agent: No, it will not. This also means that you can not renew the registration, if there is no record of inspection within the past 12 months.

user: What kind of ehicles are exempt from the emissions inspection? agent: Motorcycles, vehicles that are less than two model years old model year is greater than or equal to calendar year minus one, and more than 25 model years old model year is less than or equal to calendar year minus 25
user: what if the sticker is all messed up? agent: You could have your vehicle reinspected or you can order a replacement sticker.

user: would it be a problem if my registration expires as I am about to get my plates? agent: If your registration is about to expire when you are getting ready to order your plates, you should renew your registration before you order personalized plates.
user: How many days will be drivers license be suspended? agent: It will be suspended for the same number of days your registration is suspended.

user: If my registration is suspended for a lapse of insurance, can another person register the vehicle? agent:  No. The DMV will not issue a new registration if the DMV determines that the purpose of the new registration is to avoid the suspension

user: and where can I find the application? agent: Form FS-2 is only available at a local DMV office

user: I see. And how long does a suspension usually last? agent: The registration suspension will last for the same number of days that your vehicle was registered in New York without auto liability coverage.

user: Do my kids need identification when they are travelling with me? agent: The TSA does not currently require children under 18 years old to provide identification when traveling with a companion within the United States. The companion will need acceptable identification though.

user: If I'm under 18 years old do I need a REAL ID? agent: If you are traveling with a companion within the United States, the TSA does not currently require children under 18 years old to provide identification.

user: Will do. So, what actions should I take if my vehicle is stolen? agent: Your insurance company will: 1) give you 2 barcoded original NY State Insurance ID cards or provide you with access to your digital electronic NY State Insurance ID Card 2) send an electronic notice of insurance coverage to the DMV (your insurance agent or broker cannot file this notice) Your NY State Insurance ID cards and the electronic notice together verify your coverage. We need both. You can find more information about stolen and recovered vehicles on our website.

user: Say, what should I do if a plate is lost or destroyed? agent: You will need to pay for the new plates, and a fee of $ 3.75 to issue a new registration. The fee for plates are $ 25 for a set of 2 plates.
user: I see. And how can I get new plates to replace the lost ones? agent:  You may request a new set of plates at a DMV office, provided you bring the required documents with you.

user: Are there any requirements for getting a conditional license? agent: Yes, those seeking to obtain a conditional license need to complete an Impaired Driver Program approved by the DMV.

user: Where do I apply for a restricted license? agent: You will have to apply for the license in person at a DMV office. Most DMV offices have this service available, but it's best to contact your nearest office to find out where to apply.

user: What about restricted licenses? What makes them different from conditional licenses? agent: Restricted use licenses are issued by DMV to a qualified driver who has had their license suspended or revoked because of violations that do not involve alcohol or drugs.

user: and can I do it in any office? agent: You can do this at most, but not at all Motor Vehicle offices.

user: And that license is only conditional, isn't? agent: Correct. As said before, is a special kind of license, which can be issued to those driver whose license has been suspended or revoked by alcohol or drug related situations.
